body_html: @Saisuchith - depends how it has been installed. If it's been installed directly then uninstall 3.7 and install 3.5. If you installed it with Anaconda then you can just create a new environment with a different Python version. Google is your friend here.

body: @Saisuchith - depends how it has been installed. If it's been installed directly then uninstall 3.7 and install 3.5. If you installed it with Anaconda then you can just create a new environment with a different Python version. Google is your friend here.
